M4 testpass on I20031007 + plugin-export 20031008_1008

- JUnit as source
- open an editor and enable "Show Source of Selected Element Only"
- close the editor
- Ctrl+Shift+T, open type "TestCase"
- click on "run()" in the outline
- press F12 (activate editor)
- press Left_Arrow
- Ctrl+Shift+F
- Ctrl+Shift+Z
[- variant: press Ctrl+Z instead of Ctrl+Shift+Z
=> exception at the same location, but somewhat different stacktrace and log
entry; I suspect the difference comes from platform's handling of Shift key]

=> Error Log:

Will investigate tomorrow - possible candidate for M4.
The undo manager wants to replace the segmented method with the full document.

- Format (Ctrl+Shift+F) formats the entire document, even if just a segment of
it is displayed in the viewer
- DefaultUndoManager can only manage changes to the text being displayed in the
viewer; it is cleared if the segmented view is toggled.
- Somehow the undo manager picks up the entire document change from the
formatting, which it tries to undo.
- See also bug 28253 and bug 43489
